DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study compare catheter length extravasation rate US guide peripheral IV insertion subset emergency department patient difficult IV access . Physicians , Emergency RNs , Emergency Technicians taught use US guidance start peripheral IV ED . The optimal length catheter use procedure unknown . This study provide data length catheter require minimize extravasation . There guideline catheter length selection US-guided peripheral vascular access . The study design randomize non-blinded clinical trial extravasation rate US guide peripheral vascular access relate intravenous catheter length venous depth ED . Primary endpoint duration usable vascular access . Secondary endpoint catheter length , venous depth , time procedure , successful cannulation , reason failure , number skin puncture , site cannulation , sonographic technique , type provider obtain access complication .
